intro: Schismus villarsii, commonly known as the desert spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with narrow, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Schismus villarsii is well-suited to harsh environments and is often found in desert or semi-desert habitats.
